citeinfo.title: Wild Rice Locations on Lakes and Rivers Identified by DNR Wildlife

pubinfo.publish: Minnesota DNR - Division of Fish & Wildlife - Wildlife Unit

descript.abstract: This is a point coverage of wild rice locations in Minnesota lakes and rivers, prepared to support the document:Natural Wild Rice In Minnesota:A Wild Rice Study document submitted tothe Minnesota Legislature by the MinnesotaDepartment of Natural ResourcesFebruary 15, 2008Information sources included the following:- Minnesota DNR - initial survey data, 2006 Wild Rice Harvesters Survey (Norrgard, R., Drotts, G., Drewes. A., and Dietz, N. 2007. Minnesota Natural Wild Rice Harvester Survey: A Study of Harvesters- Activities and Opinions. Management Section of Wildlife, Division of Fish and Wildlife, MinnesotaDepartment of Natural Resources, St. Paul, MN. 139 pp.), - Fisheries lake surveys, Wildlife/shallow lake surveys, aquatic plant management permits, and aquatic plant survey data from Ecological Resources.- Treaty/Tribal - 1854 Treaty Authority, Great Lakes Indian Fish and Wildlife Commission, Fond Du Lac Indian Reservation, Mille Lacs Indian Reservation, Leech Lake Indian Reservation, and, White Earth Indian Reservation. - U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, National Wildlife Refuge System
descript.purpose: This layer was created to help resource managers identify wild rice lakes and rivers for wildlife habitat restoration and enhancement, and for rice management.

theme.themekey: Hydrography, wild rice, wild rice lakes, wild rice rivers, wildlife, habitat

cntperp.cntorg: Minnesota DNR - Division of Fish & Wildlife - Wildlife Unit

dataqual.logic: Data are topologically correct using ArcView 3.x.
dataqual.complete: This is not yet a complete coverage of all wild rice locations in Minnesota.

distinfo.distliab: The Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement is online: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/sitetools/data_software_license.html

stdorder.ordering: Please visit the download page for this dataset on the Minnesota Geospatial Commons website using the web link below (Online Linkage).
